intro: Luetkea cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-gray luetkea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale pink to white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. Luetkea cinerascens typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and is often found in shaded to partially shaded environments.
